[http://www.statistics.sk/mosmis/eng/prvav2.jsp?txtUroven=410106&lstObec=508365&Okruh=zaklad MOŠ/MIS] | website = http://www.zahorskaves.sk <!-- *** Footnotes *** --> | footnotes = }} '''Záhorská Ves''' (previous name: ''Uhorská Ves''; {{lang-de|Ungeraiden}}; {{lang-hu|Magyarfalu}}) is a village situated north of [[Bratislava]], the capital city of [[Slovakia]]. It is part of the [[Malacky District]] and [[Bratislava Region]]. The village is located on the [[Morava River (Central Europe)|Morava]] river, which forms the border between Slovakia and [[Austria]]. A river ferry operates between the village and [[Angern an der March]] in Austria Záhorská Ves is the westernmost settlement in Slovakia and is located near the westernmost point in Slovakia (around {{coord|48|22|53|N|16|50|04|E|type:city_scale:30000}}) Záhorská Ves has a population of 1,632 and area of 13.06 km² at an altitude of 149 m. The settlement was first mentioned in 1557. Opera singer [[Lucia Popp]] was born there in 1939. ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.zahorskaves.sk Official website of Záhorská Ves] {{Malacky District}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Zahorska Ves}} [[Category:Villages and municipalities in Malacky District]] [[Category:Austria–Slovakia border crossings]] {{Bratislava-geo-stub}}
